title: Great system!  Took a while to get here.
text:
I have been using this app and the Panasonic system for quite a while with both the cheap cameras that come with the HNB600 hub and the newer Homehawk KX HNC800. The cheap cameras aren’t much to speak of but the Homehawks are great. 

The app has given me fits. The network configuration has been challenging but with the latest update everything is working great with really no configuration. I have removed all port forwarding and it is working fine. 

The system is quick to alert you when a sensor alarms. The sensors all take batteries so you have to periodically change them out but it isn’t too frequently. 

After the last update I am very pleased. 

It would be really nice if the developers made an Apple Watch app that could just change the arm state of the system. I have the disarm key fob but an Apple Watch app would be more convenient. 

Also it would be nice if there was a way to make the hub chirp or beep when a door is open in the at home alarm state. That way I could know if my kids went out the door without having an alarm.

First, LTE connection stopped working and only home WiFi worked, which defeats the whole purpose of having this. Then now even the WiFi connection stopped working. I get why people 1 Star this, it was working one way and then changed and everyone had a hard time connecting. I had the same issues. The thing is- people need to investigate issues before complaining about them, because 9 times out of 10, you’ll find the fix for it. But instead of just complaining, I did a little research and found that they modified the way the app works, and you need some changes made on your router. These changes were necessary for better security and performance, not just to screw with people. Once that’s done, everything was fast and smooth sailing for me. 

For those too lazy to look:

1. Set your hub to a static IP address. 
2. Forward ports 62000-63000 on your router to the static IP you assigned to your hub. 
3. Enable UPnP on your router if it is not already. 

Once I made these changes, I can access the app without issues from my home WiFi and on LTE from my cell when away from my home.

title: It was great when it worked.
text:
Second review update:
No remote of any kind via iOS on T-Mobile via 4G or LTE. Works fine via android. 

I've updated this review to reflect software and firmware changes. 

The companion app for the Panasonic Home Monitor hardware is decent. Remotely connecting to the system is an exercise in patience as all connections route through their cloud but it has improved greatly over the past few months. 

The programming logic has improved greatly over the original version. Now, multiple layers of scenarios can be enabled.

The app continues to lack persistence. It will always return to the home page and restart the linking process. There should be a way for it to stay direct connected for short period of time and to remember where you left off.

title: Still will not connect over cellular
text:
With each update I've been hoping this is one that will fix the cellular issue. Sad to report that the update today 7/31/2017, it is still unable to connect through cellular connection. Even at home on wifi, I'd have to fiddle with it by closing and reopening several times before it will connect. I really can't understand why Panasonic is unable to solve this major issue after many updates. 

I also have this app on an Android device and it has neither of these issues.

App no longer opens on iOS 11. 

Version 4.7 update ***still*** unable to connect via LTE. What’s worse is with iOS 11, the app won’t even open when connected to Wi-Fi. The strange thing is I still get alerts when it detects motion, but the app just closes itself when I open it. If I disconnect from Wi-Fi, the app will open but will not connect via LTE. 

It is a completely useless product as it is right now.

text:
This system, consisting of cameras (both indoor and outdoor), along with the other accessories will work fine provided I’m connected to my home wifi.  Once I go out of range and onto data then the problems start.  I usually have to close and open the app between 4 to 15 times before it will come up.  If you get a trip alarm, it could take you up to fifteen minutes to see the camera.  I say fifteen minutes because that is the point I flatly gave up.

You must invest in a hand set because it speaks what was tripped where the phone only beeps and you have to read it.  The handset must stay within the hub range though.  

The point I became really upset with the system is when I went to enter a sixth door sensor.  When I went to register it, it picked up the identity of a certain sensor already registered.  When it tripped, the handset (operating on the hub) correctly stated which sensor it was.  My Iphone on the other hand, said something else.  I deregistered them and reregistered them and always the same.  I called Panasonic about it and they had me reset the hub at least twice, meaning I had to redo all my set up work.  The Panasonic tech has not been able to resolve my issue.  He said he would look further into it and get back to me.  He did call back but was still unable to resolve the problem and said he would do more research and call back.  I have not heard back from the tech support, so I am returning the sixth sensor.  They say the app will take up to 50 devices, but I have only been able to get 5 to work.

I tried reregistering one last time.  The handset spoke the wrong sensor and my Iphone said yet another.  The app does NOT SYNC with the hub!   That was the last straw, I am sending it back and not adding over five sensors.

Like I said, if you use this for inside the home security, you should be fine.  If you want to access from away, then you will be very disappointed in the system.  I have well over $500 spent and I really wish I would have gone a different system.  If it worked the way they said it should, it would be great.  I would highly recommend NOT investing in this system at least until they get some of the bugs worked out.

One last thing to add here.  If a device doesn’t work right, you have to send it to their warehouse in Texas at YOUR own expense.  Make sure to test it fully so it can be returned within the thirty days or so of purchase so you can return it to the vendor.
